0.title: She found out husband is gay on honeymoon, read his chats: Lawyer of Maha woman
0.article_body: The lawyer of the 29-year-old woman who filed a complaint against her husband for cheating her by hiding that he's gay has said she came to know about his sexual orientation during their honeymoon. "While checking his mobile phone...she found his unusual WhatsApp chat with some people," he added. A court in Maharashtra's Thane rejected the man's anticipatory bail plea.

1.title: Couple steals jewellery & cash worth ₹5 lakh from friend's house in Thane
1.article_body: A couple has been arrested for allegedly stealing jewellery and cash worth ₹5 lakh from the house of a friend in Thane. The accused woman convinced her friend to allow her to stay in her house. "Two days ahead of the incident, she also called her husband, and one more man who allegedly is her boyfriend," police said.

2.title: Interview of Chahal claiming drunk Symonds, Franklin tied him, taped his mouth resurfaces
2.article_body: An interview of Yuzvendra Chahal claiming his then MI teammates Andrew Symonds and James Franklin tied him in a Chennai hotel and taped his mouth after getting drunk in 2011 has resurfaced. Chahal said he was freed after a cleaner saw him the next morning. The interview resurfaced after Chahal claimed a cricketer hung him from 15th-floor balcony in 2013.

3.title: 26/11 mastermind Hafiz Saeed sentenced to 31 years in jail by Pak court
3.article_body: An anti-terrorism court in Pakistan has sentenced Lashkar-e-Taiba co-founder Hafiz Saeed to 31 years in prison and also ordered the confiscation of all his assets. The terrorist, who masterminded the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, has also been reportedly fined PKR 3,40,000. The action has reportedly been taken in two cases of terror financing.

4.title: It was tough raising kids alone; Mira brought us together: Neliima
4.article_body: Actors Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter's mother Neliima Azeem has stated that she raised her children as a single mother and it was very tough in those days. "[Shahid's wife Mira Rajput] has brought our entire family together," she added. Neliima further said that she is happy to watch her sons do exceptionally good work after struggling for many years.

5.title: Mosquito density up by 50% in South Delhi in a year: SDMC survey
5.article_body: A six-day survey conducted by the health department of the South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) has revealed that the mosquito density has increased by 50% from last year in the areas of south Delhi. The survey, which was conducted between March 28 and April 2, reveals that most of the mosquitoes detected do not spread dengue, malaria or chikungunya.

6.title: Hatred is being spread & country is being divided: Rahul Gandhi
6.article_body: After meeting Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Sharad Yadav, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that hatred is being spread and the country is being divided. Rahul said, "I agree with what he (Sharad Yadav) said today that the country is in a very bad situation." "India was one nation earlier, [BJP] has created different nations within the nation now," he added.

7.title: Rare 'one-in 200-million' identical triplet boys from UK to turn 1, pics go viral
7.article_body: The parents of "one-in-200 million" identical triplet boys, Jimmy, Jenson and Jaxson, from Cheshire are preparing for their sons' first birthday. Gina Dewdney and her husband Craig were told by doctors that their naturally-conceived babies were a rare occurrence. "Being a mum is the best job I've ever had. It's the hardest job by far but I...love it," said Gina.

8.title: MSRTC employees protest outside Pawar's Mumbai house, throw shoes
8.article_body: Over 100 workers of Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC), who are seeking the corporation's merger with government, protested outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's residence in Mumbai on Friday. Some hurled shoes at his house. The workers blamed Pawar for not resolving their issues. "Some 120 MSRTC employees have died by suicide...These are not suicides, but murders," an employee said.

9.title: Elon Musk wears cowboy hat, drives oldest Tesla model at company event
9.article_body: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk wore a cowboy hat, and sunglasses as he drove the oldest model Tesla ever built, at Tesla's Cyber Rodeo event on Thursday. The event marked the opening of the company's Giga Texas factory near Austin. Videos from the event showed the factory plant looking like a nightclub.

10.title: Video is distorted: Hindu mahant who threatened to rape Muslim women
10.article_body: Hindu mahant Bajrang Muni Das, who was seen in a video threatening Muslim women with rape in UP's Sitapur, claimed the video was distorted to implicate him. "If they'll harass our daughters, their daughters won't be safe too," he added. "During our Kalash Yatra, (Muslims) were prepared with sticks and stones to repeat Karauli-like incident," he alleged.

11.title: Mayank's batting has been affected since becoming PBKS' skipper: Sehwag
11.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said he's concerned about Mayank Agarwal's batting in IPL 2022, adding that his batting has been affected after becoming PBKS' skipper. "He was consistent last year with the bat. He should focus on his batting and forget about his captaincy when he walks out to bat," he added. Mayank has scored 32, 1, 4 so far.

12.title: 52-yr-old man falls while alighting from moving train in Kalyan, dies
12.article_body: A 52-year-old man died after he lost his balance while alighting from a moving train fell into the gap between the platform and the footboard at Kalyan railway station. The deceased identified as Pradip Bhangale was travelling from Bhusawal to Kalyan on Thursday when the incident took place. The incident was caught on the CCTV cameras installed at the station.

13.title: Video shows ACP slapping UP man 5 times, pulling hair for eve-teasing, harassing girl
13.article_body: A video showing ACP Tirpurari Pandey slapping a man accused of eve-teasing and harassing a girl student in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. Pandey can be seen slapping the man five times before pulling his hair on a busy road. He also warned the man of dire consequences if he continued to indulge in such crimes.

14.title: I am getting a lot of FOMO for not being there: Sam Curran on IPL 2022
14.article_body: England all-rounder Sam Curran, who withdrew from IPL mega auction as he's currently recovering from a back injury, said, "I'm getting a lot of FOMO for not being there and I want to tap my CSK mates." He added, "I hope CSK make it to the playoffs, but it's been a tough start...They need to turn it around pretty quickly."

15.title: Pregnant women face many judgements, but my baby is a miracle: Debina
15.article_body: Television actress Debina Bonnerjee, who welcomed her baby girl on April 3 with husband actor Gurmeet Choudhary, has called her child a miracle. "It was tough, emotionally, physically but everything is worth it when I see her face," she added. Debina further said that pregnant women face many judgements about what to wear, what to eat and how to exercise.

16.title: Heartening to see him grow: Ashneer shares update on Shark Tank contestant
16.article_body: Shark Tank India judge Ashneer Grover took to Instagram to share a picture with Beyond Snack's Founder Manas. Speaking about Manas' business, Grover wrote, "Kerala Banana Chips was the first deal of Shark Tank Season 1 and it's heartening to see him grow 3x in scale profitably within 6 months!" Grover had invested in Beyond Snack.

17.title: Wasim Jaffer shares Hera Pheri's taxi scene to describe PBKS' selection problem
17.article_body: Wasim Jaffer shared the taxi scene from 'Hera Pheri' to describe PBKS' selection problem ahead of their clash against GT. "PBKS trying to fit Bairstow, Rabada, Livingstone, Rajapaksa and Odean Smith into the XI," he tweeted. In the scene, Om Puri's character Kharak Singh and his fellow villagers can be seen spilling out of the taxi while trying to fit.

18.title: Shahrukh could be X-factor for PBKS: Sehwag ahead of PBKS vs GT
18.article_body: Ahead of PBKS-GT in IPL 2022, Virender Sehwag said batter Shahrukh Khan could be the "X-factor" for PBKS if he bats "explosively" down the order. Meanwhile, Ajay Jadeja said pacer Kagiso Rabada is an important player. "If there's any weakness in Gujarat, it's their top-order that hasn't been exposed yet and that's why Rabada is key for Punjab," he added.

19.title: Covishield booster dose to be sold at discounted price of ₹600 plus tax: Poonawalla
19.article_body: Serum Institute of India will sell the precaution or booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine Covishield to private hospitals and vaccination centres at a "discounted price" of ₹600, SII CEO Adar Poonawalla said. This came after the government said all adults can take the booster dose from April 10. Covishield's price has been capped at ₹780 (including taxes) at private hospitals.

20.title: Locals can tell relatives they're alive: Ukraine Vice PM thanks Musk for Starlink
20.article_body: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has thanked SpaceX CEO Elon Musk for Starlink satellite internet. He said that operation of electricity and mobile communications haven't been restored in the village of Ivankiv, but "Starlink came on time". Fedorov wrote, "Locals finally are able to tell relatives that they are alive. Thanks Elon Musk, your help is priceless for Ukraine."

21.title: CBI refuses to provide update through RTI in Sushant Singh Rajput case
21.article_body: The CBI has refused to provide update in reply to an RTI query seeking information in the Sushant Singh Rajput case. The late actor was found dead at his home in Mumbai's Bandra on June 14, 2020. The CBI has stated that the case is in the process of investigation and information about the progress may impede the investigation process.

22.title: B'luru Police arrest 7 of interstate gang for trafficking women abroad
22.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru Police's Women Protection Wing has arrested seven members of an interstate gang for trafficking women abroad. Preliminary investigation suggested that women from economically weaker sections of society were trafficked abroad after the gang members lured them into lucrative jobs abroad, police said. The victims were from Karnataka, Maharashtra and other states.

23.title: India need a finisher after Dhoni: Shastri on Karthik playing T20 WC 2022
23.article_body: Discussing Dinesh Karthik's potential selection in Team India's squad for the T20 World Cup 2022, Ravi Shastri said India need a finisher after MS Dhoni's retirement from international cricket. "Karthik has got the experience, he has got all the shots," added Shastri. Karthik has scored 90 runs in three IPL 2022 matches at a strike rate of 204.54.

24.title: Japan recognises Covaxin to facilitate travel between both nations
24.article_body: Hyderabad-based Bharat Biotech informed on Friday that its COVID-19 vaccine, Covaxin, has been recognised by Japan. "The government of Japan has included Bharat Biotech's Covaxin in the list of recognised vaccines to further facilitate travel from India to Japan starting April 10, 2022," the company tweeted. This development was also confirmed by Indian Embassy in Japan.

25.title: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse...' to release in India on May 6
25.article_body: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' from the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) is set to release in India on May 6. The upcoming film will release in multiple languages, including English, Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam. The Sam Raimi directorial stars Benedict Cumberbatch, Rachel McAdams, Elizabeth Olsen and Chiwetel Ejiofor among others in pivotal roles.

26.title: Glamour isn't the reason why I joined films: Vidya on playing de-glam roles
26.article_body: Vidya Balan, while talking about playing deglamorised roles in her recently released films, said she hasn't joined films because of glamour. "I'm here to tell stories and I am fortunate to get stories, which are very different from each other, each time," the actress said. Vidya further said that she only selects such projects which appeal to her.

27.title: There will be comparisons: Sonu Sood on replacing Rannvijay in 'Roadies'
27.article_body: Sonu Sood has opened up about replacing Rannvijay Singha as the host in the upcoming season of the youth-based reality show 'Roadies'. "When you step into someone else's shoes, there will be comparisons," he said. Sonu added while the "DNA of the show" remains the same, the scale is larger and the journey is more real and raw this time.

28.title: I've been Warner's fan, enjoyed my first outing with him vs LSG: DC's Shaw
28.article_body: Talking about his experience of batting with DC opener David Warner against LSG, teammate Prithvi Shaw said it was great fun. "Once we form a good understanding, it'll be even better to bat with him," he added. "I've been a fan of the way he strikes the ball," he further said. Openers Shaw and Warner scored 61 and 4 respectively.

29.title: Gross tax collections surge to record ₹27.07 lakh crore in FY22
29.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj on Friday said that India's tax collections rose to a record high of ₹27.07 lakh crore between April 2021 and March 2022. He added that the revenue collection is almost ₹5 lakh crore above the Union Budget's estimates of ₹22.17 lakh crore. Direct tax collections in FY22 grew 49%, while indirect tax collections rose 30%.

30.title: Tom Hiddleston to star in and executive produce 'The White Darkness'
30.article_body: Actor Tom Hiddleston is set to star in and executive produce Apple's limited series 'The White Darkness'. According to Hollywood Reporter, the series is inspired by the true-life account of Lieutenant Colonel Henry Worsley, a former soldier who was deeply obsessed with adventure. The show will be penned by 'Pachinko' writer Soo Hugh who will also serve as executive producer.

31.title: Were confident about chase due to our batting depth: Bishnoi on LSG's win
31.article_body: Following LSG's six-wicket win against DC in IPL 2022, LSG spinner Ravi Bishnoi said he was confident about his side's batting depth while chasing the 150-run target. "The game got a little tight towards the end, but we still had Jason Holder and Krishnappa Gowtham to come," he added. LSG scored 155/4 in 19.4 overs.

32.title: Tribal women protest against cashew crop destruction in Andhra Pradesh
32.article_body: Tribal women staged a protest against alleged destruction of their cashew plantations by a mining company at Urlova village in Andhra Pradesh on Thursday. As a part of their symbolic protest, they imitated the act of suicide by hanging through a tree, saying they would be left with no choice but to end their lives if their plantations weren't saved.

33.title: Woman wins ₹75 cr lottery after accidentally buying wrong ticket in US
33.article_body: A woman won a $10 million (around ₹75 crore) lottery after she accidentally bought the wrong lottery ticket as a person bumped into her while she was trying to purchase a different ticket in California. As per the woman, the person bumped into her while she was selecting the ticket options and ended up buying a $30 ticket.

34.title: We were brilliant with the ball: KL Rahul on LSG's win over DC
34.article_body: After Lucknow Super Giants defeated Delhi Capitals by six wickets, LSG skipper KL Rahul said that his bowlers were "brilliant with the ball" and called the win a "complete team effort". "In the powerplay, we obviously need to go back and work on. But...we assessed things well after that and bowled better," Rahul said.

35.title: Microsoft says it disrupted Russian cyberattacks on Ukraine, EU, US
35.article_body: Microsoft has revealed that it disrupted hacking attempts by a group it nicknamed "Strontium", a Russian GRU-connected actor, aimed at breaking into Ukrainian, European Union, and American targets. The group was using seven internet domains as part of an effort to spy on Ukrainian institutions, government bodies and think tanks in the US and EU.

36.title: Show-cause notice issued to Pune hospital in kidney transplant case
36.article_body: A Pune-based hospital has received a show-cause notice over an alleged fraud during a kidney transplant procedure. The fraud reportedly occurred at Ruby Hall Clinic, where a woman allegedly posed as the wife of a man, who needed a transplant, and donated her kidney to a young woman. In return, the young woman's mother donated her kidney to the man.

37.title: Conor McGregor charged with 6 offences in driving arrest: Reports
37.article_body: UFC star Conor McGregor was charged with six offences for the dangerous driving case in which he was arrested in Dublin last month, reports said. McGregor reportedly faces two counts of dangerous driving and charges for driving without a licence, among others. Notably, the Irish fighter was released on bail and is due back in court on June 23.

38.title: BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory: Sanjay Raut
38.article_body: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Friday alleged that BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory. "A presentation...has been made to the MHA...This has been going on for the last two months and I am saying this with full responsibility," he said, adding that Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray is also aware of this development.

39.title: Sex on the basis of genuine promise to marry that didn't fructify not rape: Delhi HC
39.article_body: A sexual relationship on a genuine promise of marriage that fails to fructify due to external circumstances is not rape, said Delhi High Court. The court was dealing with a matter in which a man and a woman were in a long-term relationship and got engaged but the marriage couldn't be solemnised. The relationship had ended on hostile terms.

40.title: Love the show and Sharma sisters: Priyanka praises Netflix's 'Bridgerton'
40.article_body: Priyanka Chopra praised Netflix drama series 'Bridgerton' for representing Indian culture on the show. "It's so wonderful to see desi representation on mainstream TV. It was...an anomaly when I started. Love the show and the Sharma sisters," Priyanka wrote on Instagram Stories. Based on Julia Quinn's series of novels, 'Bridgerton' features Simone Ashley and Charithra Chandran among others.

41.title: Activision Blizzard makes 1,100 game testers full-time employees
41.article_body: Activision Blizzard has announced it'll make around 1,100 of its temporary and contract quality assurance workers in the US full-time employees, starting July 1. These employees also will be eligible to participate in bonus plan and will have access to full company benefits. "This change follows a process that began last year" across Activision Publishing and Blizzard, a spokesperson said.

42.title: Researchers identify over 5,500 new RNA viruses in the ocean
42.article_body: Researchers have identified at least 5,500 new RNA virus species from 35,000 water samples from oceans across the globe. With this discovery, scientists have doubled the number of known RNA virus phyla from five to 10 to capture the diversity of the new findings. RNA viruses are known to cause several diseases in humans ranging from common flu to COVID-19.

43.title: My mother has a lung disease, please give our dues: Fired BharatPe employee to CEO
43.article_body: A former BharatPe admin in a post said his mother has a lung disease and is hospitalised and he hasn't received his reimbursement for a few months. "I'm the oldest employee of BharatPe working day and night. Why were we thrown out of the company without any reason," Dhananjay Kumar asked CEO Suhail Sameer. "Please give our dues...back," he added.

44.title: She loves her country India: UK finance minister Sunak as he defends wife Akshata's tax
44.article_body: UK Chancellor of Exchequer Rishi Sunak defended his India-born wife Akshata Murthy amid controversy over her non-domicile tax status. Stating that it wasn't fair to ask his wife to sever her ties with India, Sunak said, "She loves her country. Like I love mine." "Every single penny that she earns in the UK she pays UK taxes on," he added.

45.title: We wanted to keep wickets in hand: De Kock after LSG's win over DC
45.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants opener Quinton De Kock said that his side "wanted to keep wickets in hand" while chasing down a target of 150 runs against Delhi Capitals on Thursday. "It was a chaseable score, but we made sure not to get too ahead of ourselves," said De Kock after scoring 80 runs from 52 balls.

46.title: Twitter staffer said staff would be probed if they tweeted like Musk: Report
46.article_body: A Twitter employee said that the platform's employees would be subjected to an HR investigation if they tweeted like Tesla Founder Elon Musk, The Washington Post reported. According to a Slack message, the employee asked if board members are "held to the same standard" as employees. Several Twitter employees are reportedly worried about Musk's addition to the platform's board.

47.title: Fire breaks out at Industrial Development Corporation in Madhya Pradesh
47.article_body: A fire broke out at the Centre for Entrepreneurship Development Madhya Pradesh (CEDMAP) and Madhya Pradesh Industrial Development Corporation (MPIDC) in Bhopal on Friday morning. "At around 6:00 am, we received the information about a fire breaking out at the office...we immediately sent two tenders to control it," a fire station official said. No casualties were reported in the incident.

48.title: England launch their new T20I jersey, share pics
48.article_body: England have launched their new T20I jersey, which will be worn by the England men's and women's teams at the upcoming T20 World Cups. The kit has been designed to enhance performance and ease of movement with fabrics that Castore have used across the highest level of their sportswear, the England and Wales Cricket Board said.

49.title: Can't leave India without permission: Court to ex-Amnesty India chief
49.article_body: A Delhi court on Friday ordered the former Amnesty International India Board chair Aakar Patel to not leave India without permission until a decision is taken on CBI's plea challenging the order to quash look out circular issued against him. The court also put on hold Thursday's order which ordered CBI to tender a written apology to Patel.

50.title: 'Naagin 6' actor Tusharr Khanna buys Audi A4 worth around ₹60 lakh
50.article_body: Actor Tusharr Khanna, who stars in Ekta Kapoor-backed show 'Naagin 6', has bought an Audi A4 worth around ₹60 lakh. He took to Instagram to share pictures of his new car. "I feel fortunate to have got love and adulation for my work which made me capable enough to own this today, can't thank well-wishers enough," Tusharr said.

51.title: My kids enjoy watching my films but they're not my fans: Sanjay Dutt
51.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt in an interview has revealed that his children enjoy watching his films but they are not his fans. Sanjay has a daughter Trishala with his first wife late actress Richa Sharma and twins Shahraan and Iqra with his wife Maanayata. In an earlier interview, he had stated that his biopic 'Sanju' is his twins' all-time favourite film.

52.title: Serena Williams hints at comeback, says 'I've got to play Wimbledon first'
52.article_body: Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams has hinted at making a comeback in this year's Wimbledon. When asked about her comeback by NFL player Aaron Rodgers, Serena said, "Wimbledon's before the US Open, I've got to play Wimbledon first." "We've been talking about my comeback...hyping me up and getting me ready for Wimbledon," the ex-world number one added.

53.title: Produce more children, else India will become 'Hindu-less': Yati Narsinghanand
53.article_body: Dasna Devi temple head priest Yati Narsinghanand, who is out on bail in Haridwar hate speech case, has urged Hindus to produce more children to prevent India from becoming "Hindu-less" in the coming decades. "Mathematical calculations state that a non-Hindu will become PM in 2029," he added. Narsinghanand called for a religious assembly in the Mathura-Govardhan region from August 12-14.

54.title: I promise fines for Muslims wearing headscarves: French presidential candidate
54.article_body: French presidential candidate Marine Le Pen on Thursday vowed to issue fines to Muslims who wear headscarves in public. "People will be given a fine in the same way that it is illegal to not wear your seat belt. It seems to me that the police are very much able to enforce this measure," she said.

55.title: A high-end designer told me 'That lehenga isn't for you': Yami
55.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has revealed certain high-end designers refuse to give their outfits because you are not so and so. She added she was once told 'No, that lehenga is not for you' and when she asked why, they said, 'No, just doesn't work with that designer'. "It was so mean...how can you make someone feel so bad?" Yami said.

56.title: BJP conspiring to make Mumbai a UT, I have proof: Sanjay Raut
56.article_body: BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory (UT), Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said. "A presentation about the same has been made to the Ministry of Home Affairs...Meetings have been held...funds are being collected," he claimed. "This has been going on for the last two months...I have the proof to substantiate what I am saying," Raut further said.

57.title: We're confident of what we've made: Shahid on not releasing Jersey on OTT
57.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about the decision to release 'Jersey' in theatres despite getting many offers from the OTT platforms, said, "We're confident of what we've made." "We made [it] with the intent of being viewed on...big screen," he added. "The emotionality of the film is such that it's best when viewed with a group of people," Shahid further said.

58.title: Rahul runs Cong round-the-clock, should be made party chief: Sharad Yadav
58.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Sharad Yadav backed Rahul Gandhi's name for the post of Congress President and said that he runs the party "round the clock".  "I think he should be made the party president. Only then can something big be done," Yadav said. Rahul Gandhi met Yadav today, weeks after he merged his LJD party with RJD.

59.title: Pink Floyd members reunite to release 1st song in 28 yrs to raise money for Ukraine
59.article_body: Pink Floyd members have reunited and are releasing their first song in almost 30 years to raise money for the people of Ukraine. The track 'Hey Hey Rise Up' features Pink Floyd members David Gilmour and Nick Mason along with Ukrainian singer Andriy Khlyvnyuk. This will be Pink Floyd's first original song since 1994's 'The Division Bell'.

60.title: UK targets 'lavish lifestyles' of Putin's daughters with new sanctions
60.article_body: The UK on Friday added Russian President Vladimir Putin's two daughters to its sanctions list in a bid to undermine the "lavish lifestyles of the Kremlin's inner circle" amid the Ukraine war. Katerina Tikhonova and Maria Vorontsova will be subjected to travel bans and asset freezes, the UK government said. Earlier, the US had imposed sanctions on Putin's daughters.

61.title: 2 suspected Pak spies give flat, iPhones to officials of US Prez's secret services
61.article_body: US has busted an alleged ISI cell of Pakistan trying to intrude into the American intelligence and security apparatus including Secret Service which is in charge of the security of the President. The suspected Pakistani spies, Arian Taherzadeh and Haider Ali, allegedly provided members of the US Secret Service with rent-free flats, iPhones, surveillance systems among other things

62.title: Regret that I didn't do it sooner: Khloe Kardashian on getting a nose job
62.article_body: Khloe Kardashian recently talked about getting a nose job on 'The Kardashians: An ABC News Special'. Khloe said she always wanted to get a nose job. "But it's in the middle of your face and it's scary to think about," she told host Robin Roberts. "My only regret is...I didn't do it sooner," she said while responding to a fan.

63.title: Rohit got frustrated against Umesh who is currently all over him: Hogg
63.article_body: Reacting to Rohit Sharma's 12-ball 3 in MI's IPL 2022 defeat against KKR, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Rohit got frustrated while facing Umesh Yadav who is currently "all over" the MI captain. Umesh dismissed Rohit for the fifth time in IPL history during the match. Umesh is IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder with nine wickets in four matches.

64.title: Probably the find of IPL 2022 so far: Jaffer on LSG batter Badoni
64.article_body: Praising Ayush Badoni, Wasim Jaffer said the 22-year-old LSG batter is probably the find of IPL 2022 so far. Badoni came to bat with five needed off five balls, hitting a four and a six to help LSG win by six wickets against DC on Thursday. He added that Badoni looks like a "real talent" with the way he finished.

65.title: Sex racket operating in guise of spa busted in Pune; 3 women rescued
65.article_body: Police have busted a sex racket that was being operated in the guise of a massage and spa centre in Pune's Baner. After receiving a tip-off, police sent a decoy customer to the Divine Spa Centre and later carried out a raid at the centre. Subsequently, police rescued three women and arrested four persons, including the manager of the centre.

66.title: 'Dragon-like' sea creature captured by fisherman in Norway, pic goes viral
66.article_body: A Russian fisherman has shared a picture of a sea creature that resembles a baby dragon, captured by him from the Norwegian Sea. Roman Fedortsov caught the creature, whose pictures have gone viral online, while fishing off the coast of Tromsø in Norway. It has reportedly been identified as a chimaera, a cartilaginous fish also known as a 'ghost shark'.

67.title: I got shouted at so many times: Jacqueline recalls shooting for song in Aladin
67.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez recalled shooting for a song with Amitabh Bachchan in her debut film 'Aladin', and said, "I had no idea what I was doing, I got shouted at so many times on sets." "It was great to be thrown into that because it made me realise...if I want to be in this industry...I should...work my hardest," Jacqueline added.

68.title: GT may not consider Vijay Shankar after PBKS match: Aakash Chopra
68.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said GT may not consider Vijay Shankar for selection after their IPL 2022 match against PBKS. "He is neither picking wickets with the ball nor is he scoring runs with the bat and number three is an important slot," added Aakash. "At number three, if he gets an opportunity, this will be Shankar's last innings," stated Aakash.

69.title: 3 Shanghai officials sacked over COVID-19 response amid lockdown
69.article_body: Three local officials in Shanghai were sacked over a slack response to the COVID-19 outbreak in China's financial hub. An official notice didn't give details of the allegations against the officials but said their failure to fulfil their duties led to a "serious impact" on efforts to control the outbreak. Shanghai has placed its 26 million residents under lockdown.

70.title: MI will now realise the impact of a strong bowling attack: Mohammad Kaif
70.article_body: Reacting to MI recording their third defeat in a row in IPL 2022, ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said MI will now realise the impact of a strong bowling attack. PBKS will take on GT today with pacer Mohammad Shami a part of the latter's squad. "With the new ball, there isn't a more dangerous bowler than Shami," added Kaif.

71.title: Don't give a crap about selection: Usman Khawaja on white-ball cricket
71.article_body: Australia batter Usman Khawaja said he has stopped giving a crap about selection for white-ball cricket, after being dropped from the white-ball squad despite averaging 50. "I was the second or third-highest run-scorer in that calendar year in white-ball cricket," added Khawaja. "If they want to pick me, they can pick. If they don't, my head's not...there," stated Khawaja.

72.title: Congress councillor held for beating up merchant in Kerala's Kochi
72.article_body: A Congress councillor, Tibin Devassy, was arrested for allegedly beating up a local merchant and forcibly taking away money from him in Kerala's Kochi, police said. The Island South councillor was arrested along with two other accused. The merchant alleged that Devassy and others kidnapped and beat him up, and forcibly made him transfer ₹2 lakh to their bank account.

73.title: Rare white kangaroo spotted in Australia, pics go viral
73.article_body: A rare white kangaroo was spotted in outback Queensland, Australia by a local. It was spotted by Nogo Station resident Sarah Kinnon. "I was just out with my husband, we were dropping some rams back to the paddock...It was pretty incredible, if you put a white sheet of paper next to it, that's how white it was," she said.

74.title: He won't be successful playing responsibly: Sehwag on Pant's 36-ball 39*
74.article_body: Reacting to DC captain Rishabh Pant's unbeaten 39 off 36 balls in the loss against LSG, Virender Sehwag said Pant won't be successful in IPL 2022 if he plays responsibly. "Pant should come and hit the ball and if he misses he goes back," added Sehwag. "Pant should look at his own videos...[which] can help him gain confidence," stated Sehwag.

75.title: BIAL, Amazon Web Services to collaborate for innovation centre at B'luru airport
75.article_body: The Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) is working with Amazon Web Services (AWS), to establish a Joint Innovation Centre (JIC) at Kempegowda International Airport to drive the development and adoption of digital solutions in aviation. "This is the first JIC by AWS established outside China and its first JIC dedicated to advancing the aviation industry," BIAL said in a statement.

76.title: How have players bought for at least ₹10 crore in IPL mega auction performed so far?
76.article_body: MI's Ishan Kishan, the most expensive buy in IPL 2022 mega auction at ₹15.25 crore, has scored 149 runs so far. KKR captain Shreyas Iyer (₹12.25 crore) has scored 69 runs. PBKS' Liam Livingstone (₹11.5 crore) has scored 98 runs and has taken two wickets. DC's Shardul Thakur (₹10.75 crore) has conceded 118 runs in 11.4 overs with one wicket.

77.title: Cracked skull, almost died doing stunt for 'Armour of God': Jackie Chan
77.article_body: Jackie Chan revealed that he cracked his skull open and almost died performing a stunt for 1986 film 'Armour of God'. He said he was supposed to drink beer from a can before jumping into a tree but had to retake the scene and got drunk. When he leaped towards the tree, the branches snapped and he fell, Jackie added.

78.title: Pooja Bhatt to star in Sudhanshu Saria's 'Sanaa'
78.article_body: Pooja Bhatt is set to star in Sudhanshu Saria's women-oriented film 'Sanaa'. While talking about the film, Pooja said it is an "astonishingly perceptive" film which examines the lives of women "as we actually live it and not in a way the world thinks or wishes that we do". 'Sanaa' will also feature Radhika Madan, Shikha Talsania and Sohum Shah.

79.title: Man shot at while resisting robbery bid at Ghaziabad jewellery shop
79.article_body: A 37-year-old man was shot at by two armed men when he tried to resist their robbery attempt at his father's jewellery shop in Ghaziabad's Nehru Nagar area on Thursday. The victim, who's said to be critical, sustained a gunshot on the upper abdomen. Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation into the matter and are trying to trace the accused.

80.title: Zerodha CEO promises half month's pay to staff who lose weight, shares post
80.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath tweeted that employees with a BMI under 25 will get half a month's salary as a bonus. He added that while the average BMI of the team is 25.3, if it's under 24 by August, everyone will get another half a month's salary as a bonus. He also invited other companies to compete in this.

81.title: They don't exist for me: Divya Agarwal on trolls, negative comments
81.article_body: Actress Divya Agarwal while talking about being targeted by online trolls and negative comments, said, "I've...not seen them (trolls) in their real self. So for me, they don't exist." Further, Divya said that while she is grateful for the positive messages, she does not let them affect her as well. "I'm clear in balancing the positive and negative," she added.

82.title: Man kills labourer to frame girlfriend in Mumbai, arrested
82.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested by Ambernath Police for allegedly murdering an unknown labourer to frame his girlfriend of 15 years in the murder case. He suspected she was having an affair and wanted revenge. He even dropped her voter ID card on the body. After interrogating the woman, police learned she was not involved in the crime.

83.title: BharatPe CEO was drunk when he accused me of stealing money: Ashneer
83.article_body: Ashneer Grover said BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer must prove that he wasn't "under the influence of alcohol and drugs" when he accused Grover of stealing money from the company. "The said reply was put (on LinkedIn)...after a night of drunken debauchery by Suhail at BharatPe's offsite in Goa," Grover alleged. He demanded that Suhail be put on leave of absence.

84.title: 4 members of family including 2 children killed as AC explodes in Karnataka
84.article_body: A couple and their two children were killed due to an explosion in an air conditioner (AC) in a village in Karnataka's Vijayanagara district. A preliminary probe has revealed that the fire broke out after gas leaked from the AC vent, triggering an electric short circuit, which further led to an explosion. The entire house was also gutted in fire.

85.title: India's PV Sindhu, Kidambi Srikanth reach 2022 Korea Open semis
85.article_body: Indian shuttlers PV Sindhu and Kidambi Srikanth entered the 2022 Korea Open semi-finals in the women's singles and men's singles events respectively at Palma Stadium on Friday. Third seeded Sindhu beat seventh seeded Busanan Ongbamrungphan of Thailand 21-10, 21-16 in 44 minutes in the quarter-finals. Meanwhile, Kidambi Srikanth, seeded fifth, defeated Son Wanho 21-12, 18-21, 21-12 in 62 minutes.

86.title: It's a big deal AR Rahman approved Tiger Shroff's singing: Nadiadwala
86.article_body: Producer Sajid Nadiadwala has revealed that Tiger Shroff will be singing for AR Rahman by voicing the song 'Miss Hairan' in 'Heropanti 2'. Sajid further said it's a big deal that Rahman has approved him, adding that Tiger has been singing since school. "Knowing Tiger, I am sure he must have given a test for his singing too," he added.

87.title: BJP trying to take India in direction of a crisis similar to Sri Lanka: Gehlot
87.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has said that the BJP-led Centre is trying to take India in the direction of an economic crisis similar to Sri Lanka. "In Sri Lanka, people do not have food because there too the attention was diverted in the name of nationalism...The Modi government is trying to take India in the same direction," Gehlot said.

88.title: Largest annual rise of atmospheric methane seen since 1983: NOAA
88.article_body: Scientists observed the largest annual increase of atmospheric methane in 2021 since systematic measurements began in 1983, NOAA said. The increase last year was 17 parts per billion (ppb). Atmospheric methane levels averaged around 162% greater than pre-industrial levels in 2021. Scientists estimate global methane emissions in 2021 were 15% higher than in the 1984-2006 period.

89.title: All aged above 18 can take precaution dose against COVID-19 from April 10
89.article_body: The government on Friday said that everyone above the age of 18 years can take the precaution dose of COVID-19 vaccines from April 10, 2022, onward. The dose can be taken by those eligible at private vaccination centres, the Health Ministry said. It can be taken nine months after the administration of the second dose, it added.

90.title: Punjab Police books Delhi BJP spokesperson Naveen Kumar Jindal
90.article_body: Punjab Police on Thursday booked Delhi BJP spokesperson Naveen Kumar Jindal for sharing a doctored video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. In the video, Kejriwal is heard saying that he now takes money from corruption, along with Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and other AAP MLAs. "After winning Punjab, Kejriwal thinks of Punjab Police as his father's grandson," Jindal tweeted.

91.title: 20 kids fall ill at Ghaziabad society; water contamination suspected
91.article_body: Nearly 20 children reportedly fell sick at Landcraft Golflinks, a residential society, in Ghaziabad on Wednesday, prompting health department officials to send their teams for checkups. Officials suspect consumption of contaminated water may have been the cause of the sickness as residents have alleged impurities in the society's water tank. Meanwhile, water samples have been sent for lab testing.

92.title: Told journalist to strip down to underwear to prevent suicide: MP policeman
92.article_body: After a picture of a journalist along with some other people stripped half-naked at a police station in Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi went viral, police said it was done from a "safety point of view". The men were "kept in underwear...so that they did not die by suicide [using] their clothes", the SHO of Kotwali Police Station Manoj Soni said.

93.title: Video shows car turning turtle after jumping red light in Hyd
93.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police on Friday shared a video from Kompally, Alwal in Hyderabad, showing how jumping a red light at night is not safe. The video shows a speeding car hitting an auto after jumping the red light. After the crash, the car turned turtle. Police revealed that the auto driver and co-passenger suffered minor injuries.

94.title: At least 35 dead as 2 rockets hit train station used for evacuations in Ukraine
94.article_body: At least 35 people have died and around 100 others have been injured after two rockets hit a train station that was being used for civilian evacuations in eastern Ukrainian city of Kramatorsk. Earlier this month, Russia accused Ukraine of carrying out an airstrike on a fuel depot in the Russian city of Belgorod.

95.title: Completion of womanhood requires giving birth: HC on parole to man to procreate
95.article_body: Rajasthan High Court has granted a 15-day parole to a man currently serving a life sentence for murder on the grounds of want of progeny. Citing Hindu philosophy of four Purusharths, namely Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha, the court observed that "for a married woman, completion of womanhood requires giving birth to a child".

96.title: Himachal ministers, MLAs will now pay tax as 5-decade-old practice ends
96.article_body: The Himachal Pradesh cabinet has now decided to end the five-decade-old practice of the state bearing the income tax amount on salaries and allowances paid to its ministers and legislators. This decision comes after the Himachal Pradesh High Court sought response from the state government on a PIL challenging the provisions of Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly allowing such exemptions.

97.title: Over ₹10 cr collected by Pune railway division from passengers as penalty
97.article_body: The Pune railway division has collected ₹10.94 crore in fines from passengers for travelling without tickets from 2021-22. According to the Pune railway division, almost 2,17,633 passengers were penalised for not having a ticket. "If the passenger is unable to pay the fine, then they will be arrested by the railway police," said Manoj Jhawar, Pune railway division spokesperson.

98.title: Pic of horse travelling in a crowded train in West Bengal goes viral, probe ordered
98.article_body: A photo of a horse standing inside a crowded local train in West Bengal is being widely circulated on social media. While the Railways has ordered a probe into the incident, a fact-check of the photo has also been ordered. The horse was reportedly returning after taking part in a race in Baruipur with its owner.

99.title: 3 Adani Group firms get ₹15,400 crore investment from Abu Dhabi's IHC
99.article_body: Adani Enterprises announced on Friday that Abu Dhabi-based conglomerate International Holding Company PJSC (IHC) will invest $2 billion as primary capital in three Adani Group companies. IHC will invest ₹3,850 crore in Adani Green Energy, ₹3,850 crore in Adani Transmission, and ₹7,700 crore in Adani Enterprises. The boards of the companies have approved the transaction, Adani Enterprises said.

100.title: Sonu Sood granted Dubai Golden Visa, actor says 'I'm grateful'
100.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood has been granted the Dubai Golden Visa. "I'm incredibly honoured and grateful to...Dubai government for Golden Visa. Dubai has been one of my favourite destinations to visit. It's a dynamic place to thrive. I'm thankful to...authorities for the privilege," he said on receiving the Golden Visa. Boney Kapoor and his family also hold the Dubai Golden Visa.

101.title: Mahindra's deal to sell SsangYong to S Korea's Edison terminated
101.article_body: Mahindra & Mahindra's deal to sell its subsidiary SsangYong Motor to South Korean electric carmaker Edison Motors has been terminated. Edison's inability to deposit the bid amount led to the termination of the deal, Mahindra said in an exchange filing. Mahindra owned about 75% of SsangYong as of September-end 2021, which it bought in 2010.

102.title: Dealer who supplied gun to Northeast Delhi riot accused held
102.article_body: A firearms dealer was arrested by the Delhi Police for allegedly supplying a pistol to Shahrukh Khan, who is accused of rioting during the Northeast Delhi riots in 2020. "Babu Wasim had been absconding for over two years... Wasim has admitted to having supplied the said pistol... to Shahrukh Khan prior to the riots," Jasmeet Singh, DCP Special Cell, said.

103.title: Shark Tank India pitchers rejected by Ashneer Grover meet up, fans react
103.article_body: Shark Tank India pitchers Rohit Warrier and Niti Singhal, who were rejected by Ashneer Grover, recently met  and posted a video of their meeting on Instagram. "Weird pitches? Not so weird now!" Niti wrote in the caption. "Divided by Shark Tank united by Ashneer," a person commented while another comment read, "When two people have common enemies, they become friends."

104.title: Veteran actress Sripriya's daughter Sneha gets married to Anmol Sharma
104.article_body: Sneha Sethupathi, daughter of actors Rajkumar Sethupathi and Sripriya, got married to Anmol Sharma in Chennai. A few pictures from their wedding have also surfaced online. According to reports, the pre-wedding festivities started on April 4, and the duo tied the knot on April 6. The wedding was attended by R Sarath Kumar, Radikaa Sarathkumar, Khushbu Sundar and others.

105.title: EU President, diplomatic chief travelling to Kyiv amid conflict
105.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said she is travelling to Ukraine's capital Kyiv, along with the bloc's diplomatic chief Josep Borrell and Slovak PM Eduard Heger. She is the most senior Western leader to go to Kyiv since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24. She will hold talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during the visit.

106.title: Elderly man, 3 sons rape his 17-yr-old foster daughter in Chennai, booked
106.article_body: Police booked a 65-year-old man along with his three sons, aged 39, 29 and 24 for allegedly raping his 17-year-old foster daughter. The girl's biological parents had sold her to a couple when she was one month old. Her youngest foster brother sexually abused her when she was 15, later, the other accused also started raping her repeatedly, police said.

107.title: Sec 144 imposed in Assam's Sivasagar as measure to avert anti-social activities
107.article_body: Amid concerns over the law and order situation, the district administration has imposed Section 144 in Assam's Sivasagar, along with a night curfew along the state border with Nagaland, to prevent anti-social activities. The restrictions will remain enforced for the next 60 days or until further notice. Officials have also prohibited pillion-riding on two-wheeler vehicles, with certain exemptions.

108.title: Teen electrocuted to death while taking selfie atop train engine in MP
108.article_body: A 16-year-old boy was electrocuted to death while taking a selfie atop a stationary train engine at Chhatarpur Railway Station in Madhya Pradesh, an official said. "The victim tried to grab an overhead high tension electricity line, which was charged," Railway Protection Force (RPF) inspector Jitendra Kumar said. A few youths manhandled the station master following the incident.

109.title: Woman fearing safety pretends to order pizza on 999 in UK, gets man arrested
109.article_body: A man was arrested after a woman fearing for her safety called 999 and pretended to order a pizza while they were on a bus in the UK. Sensing that the woman was in danger, the police asked her yes or no questions. She was then rescued after the police traced her location using tracking data and arrested the man.

110.title: Always a question mark on Shubman's power-hitting, strike rate: Jaffer
110.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said there is always a question mark on GT opener Shubman Gill's power-hitting and strike rate, but termed his 46-ball 84 against DC at a strike rate of 182.60 as outstanding. Talking about Vijay Shankar, Jaffer stated it's a matter of concern that Shankar got the chance to bat at the number three position for GT.

111.title: Don't buy into phrases like '2 bodies 1 life' for married couples: Vidya Balan
111.article_body: Talking about gender imbalance in society, Vidya Balan said, "When a couple gets married...people use sentences like '2 bodies 1 life' and I keep saying, 'Listen...please don't buy into that because do jism aur aadmi ki jaan...humari jaan rehti nahi hai'." "There's a change in the way we women are looking at ourselves...what we want from our lives," added Vidya.

112.title: Police officers can't use battalion personnel as domestic help: Assam govt
112.article_body: No Assam Police officer will be allowed to use any battalion personnel as domestic help, the Assam government said. The state government added that if any officer is found using battalion personnel for personal, household works then they will have to pay their salary, the government won't pay. "We want to abolish this system," Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

113.title: Ukraine forces now in control of Sumy region bordering Russia: Governor
113.article_body: Ukrainian forces are now in control of the entire northeast region of Sumy along the border with Russia, its governor claimed. "The area is free of orcs," Dmytro Zhyvytsky said, on Facebook, referring to invading Russian troops. However, he warned residents that "the region isn't safe as there are many areas that have been mined and are still not cleared".

114.title: Paytm-backer Elevation Capital raises $670 mn, its largest India fund
114.article_body: Early-stage investor Elevation Capital, which has backed Swiggy and Paytm, among other Indian startups, has closed its latest India-dedicated fund at $670 million, its largest-ever. Elevation said it would look to deploy the fresh capital over a three-year time frame. It will invest in sectors such as consumer internet, fintech, SaaS, apart from emerging themes such as Web3 and cryptocurrency.

115.title: Ajmer bans loudspeakers at religious places to curb noise pollution
115.article_body: Ajmer district administration banned the use of loudspeakers in public and religious places with effect from April 7 to curb noise pollution. Violators who don't abide by the order will be booked under IPC section 188 (Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant), the notice read. The administration had earlier banned religious flags and banners in the district.

116.title: Russian forces have fully withdrawn from northern Ukraine: UK
116.article_body: Russian forces have fully withdrawn from northern Ukraine to Belarus and Russia, UK's Ministry of Defence said on Friday. At least some of these Russian forces will be transferred to East Ukraine to fight in the Donbas, it added. "Russian shelling of cities in the east and south continues," the ministry further said.

117.title: Over 5 B'luru schools get bomb threats via email; bomb squads conduct searches
117.article_body: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Friday said that more than five schools in the city have received bomb threats through emails. There is a drill and as per that the bomb squads have reached the spots and are conducting checks, Pant added. As per reports, no explosive material has been found at any of the schools so far.

118.title: Train runs over 3 youths trying to make Instagram reel in Tamil Nadu
118.article_body: Three youths died after a passenger train ran over them near Tamil Nadu's Chengalpattu when they were trying to make an Instagram reel. Police said one of the deceased is a college student, while another is a daily wage worker. "We are going through their social media profiles to check if they had uploaded similar videos earlier," an officer said.

119.title: 4th pillar of democracy dismantled: Rahul on journalists stripped in MP
119.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi criticised the Madhya Pradesh government after photos of journalists forced to strip to their undergarments at a police station in Sidhi went viral on social media. "The fourth pillar of democracy ‍was dismantled in the lockup! Either sit in the lap of the government and sing their praises or go to jail," Rahul Gandhi tweeted.

120.title: I started shivering when Dhoni asked me to bowl: Harbhajan on 2011 WC semi vs Pakistan
120.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has revealed that he started shivering when MS Dhoni asked him to bowl in the second spell in the 2011 World Cup semi-final against Pakistan. "They were batting really well at that stage. He asked me to bowl after the drinks break. I did not want to show people the pressure," Harbhajan added.

121.title: Kashmiri Pandits stopped from attending event on 'The Kashmir Files' in Pune
121.article_body: Two Kashmiri Pandit community members in Pune were allegedly stopped by police from attending an event on 'The Kashmir Files', said Rohit Kachroo, national coordinator of 'India 4 Kashmir'. The members wanted to ask some questions related to Kashmiri Pandit issues, Kachroo added. "Our purpose was to not let any law and order situation arise," a senior police inspector said.

122.title: Singapore jails Australian for throwing wine bottle, killing Muslim man
122.article_body: A Singapore court sentenced an Australian man to five-and-a-half years in prison for throwing a wine bottle and killing a 73-year-old Muslim man in 2019, saying it was an act of "religious hostility toward Muslims". Andrew Gosling had pleaded guilty to throwing the bottle at a Muslim family group as he was "angry" over ISIS attacks in Bali and Melbourne.

123.title: Ad in Delhi reads 'Russian@20000/-, p**sy@2000/-'; women panel chief posts video
123.article_body: A digital advertisement board at a store in Delhi was allegedly hacked after which obscene advertisements were flashed on it. Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal shared a video showing the LED board running the advertisement of a spa, that read, "Russian@20000/-, p**sy@2000/-." "Shameful...Spas are not at all scared by MCD and Delhi Police," Maliwal wrote.

124.title: US Speaker Nancy Pelosi tests COVID-19 +ve, Asia trip delayed
124.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has postponed a planned congressional trip to Asia after she tested positive for COVID-19 on Thursday. On Wednesday, the 82-year-old was seen at a White House event with US President Joe Biden while not wearing a mask. The White House said that the President has tested negative for COVID-19 after coming into contact with Pelosi.

125.title: RBI won't do anything that goes against sanctions on Russia: Governor Das
125.article_body: During a press conference following the RBI monetary policy announcement, Governor Shaktikanta Das said that RBI "will not do anything that goes against the sanctions" on Russia. Das added, "If and when some rupee-ruble trade mechanism is worked out, you will get to know. We are sensitive to the sanctions." Earlier, India bought oil from Russia at discounted rates.

126.title: Twitter to test letting users 'unmention' themselves in tweets
126.article_body: Twitter will be testing a way to help users "unmention" themselves in tweets. It's doing so to help users "protect" their "peace" and remove themselves from conversations they don't want to be a part of. The experimental offering is limited to the web for now. Twitter has described the test as global but "small".

127.title: IT dept attaches 41 properties linked to Sena leader Yashwant Jadhav
127.article_body: Income Tax department has attached 41 properties linked to Shiv Sena leader and Chairman of the Standing Committee of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, Yashwant Jadhav, ANI reported. He is accused of tax evasion, the report added. The attached properties include 31 flats in Byculla's Bilkhadi Chamber Building, a flat worth ₹5 crore in Bandra and Hotel Crown Imperial in Byculla.

128.title: I can't romance Alia Bhatt: Sanjay Dutt on embracing his age
128.article_body: Sanjay Dutt has said he believes in moving with the times and embracing his age. "I can't romance Alia Bhatt," the 62-year-old actor said, adding, "You've to come to terms with it...You've got to move on." Sanjay further said he admires the younger generation of actors, like Alia and her partner Ranbir Kapoor, with whom he'll be seen in 'Shamshera'.

129.title: Liquorice may help with cancer treatment: Study
129.article_body: Liquorice, a popular candy, may help in preventing and treating certain types of cancers, a study stated. Researchers have found that a substance, glycyrrhizin, derived from the liquorice plant, Glycyrrhiza glabra has great anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties. They are studying liquorice further to determine if it could be used to prevent or stop the growth of prostate cancer.

130.title: BJP MLA Nitesh Rane refuses to file bond of good behaviour to Mumbai Police
130.article_body: BJP MLA Nitesh Rane, booked in a case over his statements about Disha Salian's death case investigation, refused to furnish a bond of good behaviour with Mumbai Police and termed the show cause notice "bad in law". Assistant Commissioner of Police Shailendra Dhivar had issued the notice to the BJP MLA asking him to execute a good behaviour bond.

131.title: US Army suspends SpaceX's application to expand Texas launch site
131.article_body: The US Army Corps of Engineers has suspended SpaceX's application for an expansion of its South Texas launch site after it failed to provide requested information. "Without the requested information, the permit process cannot continue," the Army Corps said. The information that officials have sought includes any impacts associated with SpaceX's plans and data on endangered or threatened species.

132.title: Senate confirms Jackson as first Black woman on US Supreme Court
132.article_body: The US Senate on Thursday confirmed Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court, making her the first-ever Black female justice. The 51-year-old was confirmed by a 53-47 vote. US President Joe Biden called the confirmation "a historic moment for our nation". "We have taken another step toward making our highest court reflect the diversity of America," Biden said.

133.title: Faith steers us through stormy seas: RBI Governor quotes Gandhi in note on economy
133.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das concluded his monetary policy speech by quoting Mahatma Gandhi. "It is faith that steers us through stormy seas, faith that moves mountains and faith that jumps across the ocean," he said. Earlier, he said Russia-Ukraine war poses an "overwhelming challenge" and the RBI is "prepared to defend the Indian economy with all instruments at its command".

134.title: Navi Mumbai man denied pre-arrest bail for hiding homosexuality from wife
134.article_body: A court has rejected the pre-arrest bail application of a 32-year-old man from Navi Mumbai, who allegedly cheated his wife by hiding his homosexuality. The woman claimed that her husband allegedly forged a job offer letter, showing ₹14 lakh salary per annum, to impress her and also forced one of his gay partners to accompany them to their honeymoon.

135.title: MP govt planning to teach Bhagavad Gita in degree courses: CM Chouhan
135.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday said the state government is planning to teach Bhagavad Gita in the second year of the degree course. "I have read Gita since childhood," Chouhan said, adding it teaches us to work without thinking about results. "This knowledge enables people to keep on working which...brings encouraging and constructive results," he said.

136.title: Delhi auto drivers call for a strike over CNG price hikes
136.article_body: Sections of auto drivers in Delhi have called for a strike on Friday over CNG price hikes, ANI reported. Associations of auto, cab and taxi drivers will hold protests at Jantar Mantar. "If we ask for ₹10-20 more from passengers, they get off the auto," an auto driver said. CNG price has increased by over ₹9 in seven days.

137.title: Mumbai's Haji Ali, Bandra-Worli sea-link at risk of submergence by 2050: Report
137.article_body: Around 998 buildings and 24 km of road length in Mumbai including Haji Ali dargah, Western Express Highway, Bandra-Worli sea-link, Queen's Necklace on Marine drive are at risk of submergence by 2050, as per the RMSI report. In addition to Mumbai, places in Kochi, Mangalore, Chennai, Visakhapatnam, and Thiruvananthapuram are also at risk of submergence, the report said.

138.title: Baba Ramdev rings opening bell as Ruchi Soya FPO shares list at 30% premium
138.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev and Patanjali CEO Acharya Balkrishna were seen ringing the opening bell at the BSE as Ruchi Soya's follow-on public offering shares listed on Friday. The shares opened at ₹855 on NSE and at ₹850 on BSE, giving over 30% premium to subscribers who were allotted shares. Before the FPO, Ramdev-led Patanjali owned 98.9% in Ruchi Soya.

139.title: People no longer come to Goa for drugs: Newly appointed Goa DGP
139.article_body: Goa's Director General of Police (DGP) Jaspal Singh, who took charge on Thursday, said people don't visit the coastal state for drugs any more, but for its beaches, culture and cuisine. "We don't want people to remember Goa for drugs," Singh said during his first press conference. He further said that various agencies need to coordinate to control drug cartels.

140.title: T'gana Chief Justice felicitates Hyd home guard for commitment towards duty
140.article_body: Chief Justice of Telangana High Court Satish Chandra Sharma on Friday felicitated Home Guard Ashraf Ali of Abids Traffic Police Station. The Chief Justice used to regularly watch Ali en route to the high court and appreciated his sense of commitment towards duty, Hyderabad Police said. Thus, while going to the High Court today, he felicitated Ali with a bouquet.

141.title: Rishabh Pant fined ₹12 lakh for slow over-rate against LSG
141.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant has been penalised after his team maintained a slow over-rate during their IPL 2022 match against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) on Thursday. As it was DC's first offence of the season relating to over-rate, Pant was fined ₹12 lakh, the IPL said. LSG defeated DC by six wickets.

142.title: Singer Avril Lavigne gets engaged to boyfriend Mod Sun, shares proposal pics
142.article_body: Singer Avril Lavigne got engaged to her boyfriend Mod Sun in Paris. Avril took to Instagram to share pictures and revealed that the engagement happened on March 27. Commenting on Avril's post, Mod Sun wrote, "I love you so much...Forever and ever my angel." "It was the most perfect, romantic proposal I could ever ask for," Avril told 'People' magazine.

143.title: It is very, very important for every MI player to be desperate: Rohit
143.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said it is very, very important for every MI player to be slightly desperate, with the franchise recently recording their third defeat in a row in IPL 2022. "We seriously cannot be blaming individuals," added Rohit. "We need to seize on the little opportunities during the game and get momentum," stated Rohit.

144.title: What will it take US to criticise Modi govt's actions against Muslims: US politician
144.article_body: US politician Ilhan Omar took to Twitter and wrote, "Why has Biden Administration been so reluctant to criticise Modi's government on human rights?" "What will it take US to criticise Modi govt's actions against Muslims?" she said in a video. "What does Modi need to do to [Muslims] before we will stop considering them a partner in peace?" she added.

145.title: Elon Musk to address Twitter staff in an 'ask me anything' session
145.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter's largest shareholder, will be addressing Twitter employees at an 'ask me anything' session. "Many of you have had different types of questions about...Musk and I want to welcome you to ask those questions to him," Twitter CEO reportedly told staff in an email. The employees have reportedly raised concerns about Musk joining the board.

146.title: No restrictions imposed on news media in Jammu & Kashmir: Centre
146.article_body: Minister of Information and Broadcasting, Anurag Thakur, has said that the Centre has not imposed any restrictions on news media in Jammu & Kashmir.  "Home Ministry has informed that there have been no instances of any harassment to the media persons by the authorities since 2017," Thakur said while responding to a question in Rajya Sabha on Thursday.

147.title: End of BJP in K'taka, says ex-PM Deve Gowda amid loudspeaker issue
147.article_body: Former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda has said that implementing the policy of banning the use of loudspeakers by religious sites will be an "end of BJP" in Karnataka. His comments came after the Bengaluru Police issued notices to 301 mosques, temples, churches, restaurants and other establishments to use their loudspeakers within the permissible decibel levels.

148.title: Delhi to get 19 more schools by the end of current financial year: Officials
148.article_body: Delhi will get 19 more schools with state-of-the-art facilities by the end of the current financial year and pre-construction work at several of these schools has started, officials said. The construction of two new schools in Southwest Delhi's Molarband and Gadda Colony area is nearing completion, officials added. Of the 19 schools, 11 will be Schools of Specialised Excellence (SoSE).

149.title: Earlier I could meet only 70% population, now I can meet 100%: Supriyo
149.article_body: TMC candidate for the Ballygunge Assembly by-poll, Babul Supriyo, has said that when he was in BJP, he could meet only "70% of the population" but now he is "free to meet 100%". "A communal stamp was imposed over my image. But it's not true," he said. Notably, West Bengal Imams Association has opposed Supriyo's candidature and called him "communal".

150.title: 66-year-old woman dies after son stabs her multiple times in Gurugram
150.article_body: A 66-year-old woman died after she was allegedly stabbed multiple times by her son in Gurugram's Shivpuri in the New Colony area on Thursday, police said. The incident took place when the victim went to give dinner to her son who lived in a separate house nearby. The exact motive for the murder is yet to be ascertained, police added.

151.title: Cardless cash withdrawal to be available at all banks, ATMs via UPI soon: RBI
151.article_body: While announcing RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "At present, the facility of cardless cash withdrawal through ATMs is limited only to a few banks." "It is now proposed to make cardless cash withdrawal facility available across all banks and ATM networks using the UPI," Das added. This would help prevent frauds such as card cloning, he stated.

152.title: HC orders CBI probe into TMC leader's murder that preceded Birbhum violence
152.article_body: The Calcutta High Court on Friday ordered the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to probe TMC panchayat leader Bhadu Sheikh's murder, which allegedly led to violence in which nine persons were burnt to death in West Bengal's Birbhum. Earlier on March 25, the High Court had ordered a CBI investigation into the killings of the nine people in Bogtui village.

153.title: World's largest diamond miner & Russian shipbuilder sanctioned by US
153.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on two Russian state-owned firms, Alrosa and United Shipbuilding Corp (USC), over Ukraine war. The USC "constructed...warships that...bombarded Ukraine", while Alrosa's proceeds helped "finance...Russian government's war", US State Department said. Alrosa, the world's largest diamond mining firm, accounts for 90% of Russia's diamond mining capacity, as per US Treasury.

154.title: Remove or place Ganesha idols 'respectfully' in Qutub complex: NMA to ASI
154.article_body: National Monuments Authority (NMA) Chairman Tarun Vijay said that the Ganesha idols placed "disrespectfully" in the Qutub Minar complex should either be removed or installed "respectfully". The former Rajya Sabha MP said that he had raised the issue with the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) more than a year ago but is yet to receive a response to his letter.

155.title: Kuldeep knows he will play for DC no matter how he bowls: Sehwag
155.article_body: Virender Sehwag said chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav knows he will be a part of DC's lineup, no matter how he bowls for the franchise in matches. "DC don't have any other spinner to replace him," added Sehwag. Kuldeep has picked six wickets in three IPL 2022 matches so far and is DC's leading wicket-taker in the ongoing edition.

156.title: Jr NTR's next with Koratala Siva to be made on a budget of ₹300 cr: Report
156.article_body: Actor Jr NTR's upcoming film with filmmaker Koratala Siva will reportedly be made on a budget of ₹300 crore. According to the report, the yet-untitled project will also feature Alia Bhatt. It'll be shot over a period of six to seven months at multiple locations, the report said. Jr NTR and Alia recently shared screen space in SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'.

157.title: Made sure nobody stands at square leg when Pant's batting in nets: Kaif
157.article_body: Ex-DC assistant coach Mohammad Kaif said they would make sure nobody stands at square leg when Rishabh Pant was batting in the nets, as Pant's bat would go towards square leg if he lost control. "We used to move to the off-side knowing he would play fewer strokes...there," added Kaif. "Pant is one of my favourite players," stated Kaif.

158.title: Shah Rukh Khan pens handwritten letter to 'Pathaan' assistant director, pic surfaces
158.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan penned a handwritten letter to Abhishek Anil Tiwari, assistant director of his upcoming film 'Pathaan'. A picture of the letter has surfaced online, wherein Shah Rukh calls Abhishek "a gem". "I love the fact that you love your drinks. Have a good life in cinema...I will miss you lots," a part of the letter read.

159.title: Russia-Ukraine war could impede India's economic recovery: RBI Governor
159.article_body: While announcing RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das said the Russia-Ukraine "war could potentially impede the economic recovery" and projected India's real GDP growth at 7.2% for 2022-23. Das added that financial market volatility induced by monetary policy normalisation in advanced economies and renewed COVID-19 infections in some countries "pose downside risks to the outlook".

160.title: He made the slow surface appear simple: De Kock on Shaw's 34-ball 61
160.article_body: LSG opener Quinton De Kock said DC batter Prithvi Shaw made the slow surface during their IPL 2022 match appear simple, scoring 61 runs off 34 balls at a strike rate of 179.41. Shaw's knock comprised nine fours and two sixes. De Kock was the match's top run-getter, scoring 80 runs off 52 balls at a strike rate of 153.84.

161.title: Russia bans Australian, New Zealand PMs from entering country
161.article_body: Russia has imposed entry bans on Australian PM Scott Morrison and New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern after they imposed sanctions on Moscow over the Ukraine war. Russian Foreign Ministry accused Australia and New Zealand of "hostile actions" towards Russia. In total, Russia on Thursday barred 228 Australian lawmakers and government members and 130 New Zealand citizens from entering the country.

162.title: Ashneer writes to BharatPe, seeks action against CEO after 'Ashneer stole money' remark
162.article_body: Ashneer Grover has written to the BharatPe board saying that CEO Suhail Sameer should "immediately be put on leave of absence" and Chairman Rajnish Kumar should "immediately resign". Earlier, Suhail in response to a comment by Ashneer's sister on LinkedIn said, "Your brother stole all the money...Very little left to pay salaries." Ashneer also demanded a written apology from Suhail.

163.title: Girl's body found in car parked inside Asaram's ashram; was missing since April 5
163.article_body: The body of a 13-year-old girl, who was missing since April 5, was recovered from a car parked inside self-styled godman and rape convict Asaram Bapu's ashram in Uttar Pradesh. The police have sent the body for a post-mortem. A person from the ashram has been taken into custody by the police for questioning in the matter.

164.title: Impose Article 356, we will win by bigger margin: TMC's Abhishek Banerjee
164.article_body: TMC's National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee claimed that his party will come back to power by winning 250 seats if Centre imposes Article 356 in Bengal. This statement comes after opposition parties have been calling for imposition of Article 356 in West Bengal after the Birbhum incident. "Many more leaders want to leave BJP and join our party," he added.

165.title: As heatwave continues in Rajasthan, Jalore records 45.2°C
165.article_body: At 45.2°C, Rajasthan's Jalore recorded the state's highest temperature on Thursday amid the heatwave, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. A maximum temperature between 41°C-43°C was recorded in several parts of Rajasthan on Thursday. For the next five days, IMD has issued a yellow alert for heatwaves and an orange alert for severe heat waves in some parts of the state.

166.title: A cricketer born on 8-4-63 scored 8,463 runs in Test cricket
166.article_body: In a unique coincidence, former England captain Alec Stewart, who was born on 8-4-63 (April 8, 1963), smashed 8,463 runs in his Test career. Stewart is the most capped Test wicketkeeper for England, playing 133 matches from 1990 to 2003. Stewart also played 170 ODIs for England, scoring 4,677 runs including four hundreds and 28 fifties.

167.title: Didn't expect appreciation from the US: Rajamouli on 'RRR'
167.article_body: Director SS Rajamouli during an event opened up on his film, 'RRR', being appreciated by the western media and said that he didn't expect the US to praise the movie. "New York Times, too, has written about our film. The western audience, particularly in...US, is liking [it]. This is the kind of thing I take to my heart," Rajamouli added.

168.title: Incidents of cybercrime, fraud recorded fivefold jump between 2018 & 2021: Govt
168.article_body: Incidents of cybercrime and fraud recorded a fivefold jump between 2018 and 2021, the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) informed a parliamentary panel. As per government data, the number of cybercrime incidents rose from 2,08,456 in 2018 to 14,02,809 in 2021. As many as 2,12,485 such cases were recorded in the first two months of 2022.

169.title: RBI hikes retail inflation projection to 5.7% in 2022-23
169.article_body: While announcing the RBI monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das said retail inflation is projected to be higher at 5.7% in 2022-23 amid a spike in crude oil prices due to Russia-Ukraine tensions. Retail inflation, which is measured by Consumer Price Index, is expected to be at 6.3%, 5.8%, 5.4%, and 5.1% in the first, second, third and fourth quarter, respectively.

170.title: Man kills labourer to implicate girlfriend in case in Thane, arrested
170.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested by Thane police for allegedly killing an unknown labourer to implicate his girlfriend in the murder case. According to police, the accused, Waman Shinde, was in judicial custody and was out on bail for few days. He suspected his girlfriend of having an affair and murdered the labourer to take revenge on her, police added.

171.title: Tesla to make a futuristic-looking dedicated robotaxi: Elon Musk
171.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said the firm will expand its "Full Self-Driving" beta software to all North American subscribers this year and will come up with a "dedicated robotaxi". He said the robotaxi is "going to look quite futuristic-looking". He made the announcement at a party to mark the opening of Tesla's $1.1 billion factory in Texas.

172.title: Ex-Maha Home Min Deshmukh 'mastermind' in money laundering case: ED
172.article_body: Former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh is the "mastermind" in the money laundering case registered against him, Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday said while opposing his bail plea in Bombay High Court. He had misused his position a lot and is hiding many important things, it added. "If granted bail, he can go out...tamper with the evidence," ED claimed.

173.title: Kerala lifts all COVID-19 restrictions; use of face masks to continue
173.article_body: In view of the current COVID-19 situation, the Kerala government on Thursday announced that all restrictions imposed in the state will be lifted with immediate effect. All advisories issued by the Centre's Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, including the use of face masks and hand hygiene, will continue to be in force, the state government added in a release.

174.title: RTI is not admission of government, answer depends on question posed: SC
174.article_body: Right to Information (RTI) is not an admission of the government as the answer provided depends on the question posed, Supreme Court said. "It's always misleading. What question is posed, depending upon that... answer is given. That's been our broad experience," it added. SC was hearing pleas over GST exemption for services provided by private tour operators to Haj pilgrims.

175.title: Ayush Badoni's Virat Kohli-like celebration after hitting match-winning six goes viral
175.article_body: LSG's 22-year-old batter Ayush Badoni's Virat Kohli-like celebration after hitting a match-winning six against DC has gone viral. Badoni was seen pointing towards his name on the jersey before pumping his fist.
