350.article_body: US-based cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase plans to more than triple its number of employees in India this year to around 1,000, CEO Brian Armstrong said. "We are going to invest for the long term in India,"  Armstrong said at a Coinbase conference in Bengaluru. Coinbase is also allowing customers to use UPI to directly purchase cryptocurrencies on the exchange.

351.title: We condemn Al-Qaeda, K'taka HM's statements on hijab row: Congress
351.article_body: Congress General Secretary Ajay Maken on Thursday said the party condemns the statement of Al-Qaeda on the hijab row. "It's a banned terrorist organisation that has no business commenting on internal affairs of India," Maken said. He added that Congress also condemns the statement by Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra as both he and Al-Qaeda are polarising the country's atmosphere.

352.title: Centre's real strength is its 'weapons of mass distraction': Tharoor on fuel price
352.article_body: Soon after LS passed a Bill on Weapons of Mass Destruction, Congress' Shashi Tharoor said, Centre's real strength is its "weapons of mass distraction". "Aided and abetted by complicit media, pointless controversies over halal, hijab and azaan have driven away focus from price rise," he tweeted. "It's clear that GOI doesn't want to discuss prices at any price!" he said.

353.title: Karnataka CM to inaugurate 'SARAS' fair in Bengaluru tomorrow
353.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai will inaugurate 'Sanjeevini SARAS-2022', a national fair of Self-Help Group women on Friday in Bengaluru, State Minister CN Ashwathnarayan said. About 700 women entrepreneurs from across the country will participate in the fair to showcase their skills and sell the products, which include handlooms, handicrafts, etc. About 310 stalls will be on display at the fair.

354.title: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Kuleba appeals to NATO to send more arms
354.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has urged NATO to provide more weapons to the country amid the ongoing Russian invasion. "We know how to win. But without sustainable and sufficient supplies...these wins will be accompanied by enormous sacrifices," Kuleba added. Ukraine's request comes amid reports of Russia regrouping its troops in eastern regions of Ukraine, after retreating from Kyiv.

355.title: CPI(M) facing most challenging times since formation in 1964: Party report
355.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) is facing its most challenging times since its formation in 1964, CPI(M) organisational report said. "The strong bases of West Bengal and Tripura are under severe attack...there has been an erosion in the party's mass...influence," it added. "CPI(M), as well as Left, have to fight against the consolidated RSS-BJP regime," the report stated.

356.title: Delhi labourer uploads morphed pics of 150 women, blackmails them to have sex
356.article_body: A labourer in Delhi has been arrested for allegedly posting morphed pictures of around 150 women online and blackmailing them to have sex with him, police said. The 30-year-old learned stalking and blackmailing women through YouTube, police added. The man said that he would download women's display pictures on social media and morph their faces with nudes downloaded from internet.

357.title: Sri Lankan Prez appoints expert team to deal with economic crisis
357.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has appointed a team of experts to deal with the ongoing economic crisis in the country. The members reportedly include former Governor of the country's central bank, former World Bank Chief Economist and former Deputy Director of the International Monetary Fund. The members had discussions with the President on key matters, said a government note.

358.title: Can’t be better tribute to Rishi, 2 actors in same role never seen: Satish
358.article_body: Discussing late actor Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen', actor Satish Kaushik said there can't be a better tribute to Rishi ji. "I remember while giving the last shot of the film, Rishi ji said he couldn't [have] given a better shot," added Satish. "There are two actors...playing the same role. It's...never happened in the history of cinema," stated Satish.

359.title: You are the real Raja Hindustani now, loved all over India: Aamir to Rajamouli
359.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that filmmaker SS Rajamouli is the "real Raja Hindustani" as he is now loved all over India. "I am hearing all good things about it and I feel people cannot stop gushing about 'RRR'. Every time someone praises the film, I call Rajamouli ji and I can hear the happiness in his voice," Aamir added.

360.title: Flight services at Bagdogra airport suspended temporarily due to runway damage
360.article_body: Flight operations at Bagdogra International Airport in West Bengal's Siliguri were temporarily suspended from 7 am on Thursday due to damage on the runway. Many passengers were stuck at the airport due to the sudden closure of flight operations. Airlines tweeted requesting their passengers to keep a check on their flight status following the crisis.

361.title: Hyd International Airport to inaugurate 1st phase of expanded terminal soon
361.article_body: The first phase of expansion work at Hyderabad International Airport will be completed soon and the new area will be open to the public. The expansion work was undertaken to cater to the rising demand in air passenger traffic. Now, the airport will be bigger and include the construction of an additional built-up area, GMR Hyderabad International Airport Limited said.

362.title: Turkey halts journalist Khashoggi trial, transfers it to S Arabia
362.article_body: A Turkish court has decided to halt the trial in absentia of 26 Saudi suspects over the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi and transfer it to Saudi Arabia. The move comes despite warnings from human rights groups that turning the case over to the kingdom would lead to a cover-up. Khashoggi was killed inside Saudi consulate in Istanbul in 2018.

363.title: 18-year-old Baby AB's no-look six against KKR goes viral
363.article_body: MI's 18-year-old batter Dewald Brevis, who is known as Baby AB, slammed a no-look six against KKR on his IPL debut on Wednesday. Brevis slammed the six on a 91.1-kmph delivery bowled by KKR spinner Varun Chakaravarthy on the first ball of MI's eighth over. Brevis sent the ball over a distance of 81 metres.

364.title: Delhi's Ambedkar University to hold all UG admissions through CUET
364.article_body: The Ambedkar University Delhi (AUD) will hold its undergraduate admissions for the academic session 2022-23 through the Common University Entrance Test (CUET), Vice-Chancellor Anu Singh Lather said on Thursday. AUD officials said that the students would first need to register on the National Testing Agency (NTA) website and on the AUD website once the CUET scores come out.

365.title: LSG are getting momentum, they are ahead of DC: Kaif
365.article_body: Talking about DC-LSG match, ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif has said KL Rahul-led LSG are "five per cent ahead" of Rishabh Pant-led DC. "LSG are getting momentum...they won [against CSK] because of their batting...[and] their last game [against SRH] due to their bowling," he added. Kaif, however, also said DC know how to make a comeback after a loss.

366.title: RAF jawan arrested for killing his 3-yr-old daughter in Navi Mumbai
366.article_body: A 39-year-old jawan attached to the Rapid Action Force (RAF) has been arrested in Navi Mumbai for allegedly murdering his three-year-old daughter on April 5 by hitting her head and stomach. Police said he had a quarrel with his wife, following which he assaulted her and their daughter. He later dumped the child's body in an open space in Taloja.

367.title: CBI submits Birbhum violence probe report to Calcutta HC
367.article_body: The CBI on Thursday submitted its initial report on the investigation into West Bengal's Birbhum violence to the Calcutta High Court. As many as nine people were killed in the violence following the killing of a TMC leader in the area. According to Indian Express sources, the report says that a large part of the evidence has been destroyed.

368.title: Bollywood lyricist Maya Govind passes away at 82, son reveals she had blood clot in brain
368.article_body: Veteran lyricist Maya Govind passed away on Thursday aged 82 at her residence in Mumbai. "She died in her sleep at home this morning...She had blood clots in...brain and had other health issues like urine infection," her son Ajay stated. Some of her famous works are songs in films like 'Aarop', 'Daman' and 'Main Khiladi Tu Anari', among others.

369.title: Meta working on digital money, employees name it 'Zuck Bucks': Report
369.article_body: Facebook and Instagram's parent company Meta is exploring the potential of digital money and employees are internally calling it "Zuck Bucks", a play on Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg's name, The Financial Times reported. Zuck Bucks is "unlikely" to be a cryptocurrency, the report said. "Instead, Meta is leaning towards introducing in-app tokens centrally controlled by the company," it added.

370.title: Rajya Sabha misses 100% productivity in Budget Session by just 10 minutes
370.article_body: The Rajya Sabha clocked 99.80% productivity during the Budget Session that concluded on Thursday, PTI reported on Thursday quoting officials. It added that the Rajya Sabha missed the 100% landmark just by 10 minutes. This is the Upper House's third-best productive session in the last 14 sessions since the Monsoon Session (243rd Session) of 2017, the Rajya Sabha officials said.

371.title: They have a lot of money, will justify it: Akhtar on MI's losing streak
371.article_body: Reacting to MI losing their third consecutive IPL 2022 match against KKR, ex-KKR pacer Shoaib Akhtar said MI have a lot of money and will do something to justify it. "At some stages, it has appeared that they are out of the tournament altogether, but have gone on to turn things around and win it as well," added Akhtar.

372.title: Mob lynchings happen if we wear skull caps, carry beard: Muslim body
372.article_body: Amid ongoing debate around Azaan and halal meat, Haji Mohammed Salees of Sunni Ulema Council said, "There's a problem if we wear skull caps, carry a beard, or wear a hijab, mob lynchings are happening. They have an eye on what we eat as well." He added Azaan gets completed in 2-3 minutes but there is problem with that too.

373.title: Conman poses as ACB official, asks B'luru engineer to pay ₹1.44 lakh to avoid raid
373.article_body: An unidentified conman allegedly posed as an ACB official and targeted a superintendent engineer of Bangalore Electricity Supply Company and threatened to raid his house. "The conman told Shanthamallappa to apply for leave on a particular day to coordinate with the raid and also gave him an option to transfer ₹1.44 lakh to stop the raid," the police said.

374.title: Will take strong measures if US House Speaker visits Taiwan: China
374.article_body: China has warned that it would take strong measures if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan. This comes after media reports suggested that Pelosi would visit China-claimed Taiwan next week. The visit would severely impact China-US relations, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zhao Lijian said, adding that Beijing opposes all forms of official interactions between the US and Taiwan.

375.title: Sleep separately, don't kiss or hug: COVID-hit Shanghai's officials warn residents
375.article_body: Amid a lockdown in China's Shanghai, residents have shared videos on social media showing health workers making public announcements using megaphones. "From tonight, couples should sleep separately, don't kiss, hug is not allowed and eat separately," workers were seen as saying. Another video showed a drone announcing, "Control your soul's desire for freedom. Do not open the window or sing."

376.title: BJP fears defeat in Himachal, wants Anurag Thakur as CM face: Sisodia
376.article_body: Ahead of Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia claimed on Thursday that BJP wants to make Union Minister Anurag Thakur its chief ministerial face. Sisodia alleged that BJP fears defeat in state and is wary of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal's "popularity". CM Jairam Thakur has done nothing for the state's residents, Sisodia added.

377.title: Maha Deputy CM urges Centre to reconsider raising CNG & PNG prices
377.article_body: Centre imposes more tax on natural gas than state government and it should reconsider this, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. In Mumbai, CNG and PNG prices increased by ₹7 and ₹5 to settle at ₹67/kg and ₹41/standard m³ respectively on Wednesday. "I do not want to impose more taxes. Rather, [Maharashtra government] reduced tax on gas," Pawar added.

378.title: Sidhu meets family of kabaddi player Dharminder who was shot dead in Patiala
378.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Thursday met the family members of the deceased kabaddi player Dharminder Singh in Patiala. "If the police are unable to arrest the accused within three days then we’ll take necessary action," Sidhu said. Dharminder was shot dead after a clash in front of Punjabi University in Patiala on Tuesday night.

379.title: Congress workers protest against fuel price hike in J&K's Srinagar
379.article_body: Congress workers on Thursday staged a protest against the fuel price hike in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir. "We have organised such protests across the country," a Congress worker said. "They (BJP-led Centre) decreased the prices before polls and increased soon after polls got over. Poor is the worst affected," the Congress worker added.

380.title: You ain't seen nothing yet: Rohit Sharma after MI lose 3 matches in a row
380.article_body: After their third defeat in a row in IPL 2022, MI captain Rohit Sharma took to Instagram to share a picture from the match against KKR and wrote, "We stick together through thick and thin and that's just one of our strengths." He added, "You ain't seen nothing yet." KKR handed MI their third straight defeat on Wednesday.

381.title: Delhi's maximum temperature likely to reach 43°C by weekend
381.article_body: The ongoing heatwave in Delhi is likely to intensify and the maximum temperature may reach 43°C by this weekend, the India Meteorological Department said. The maximum temperature in the city is predicted to reach 40°C on Thursday. The heatwave conditions are predicted from Thursday till April 13.

382.title: Makeup artist identifies dead body by her red & white manicure in Ukraine; pic surfaces
382.article_body: A makeup artist recognised the dead body of a woman she knew with the help of her manicure in Ukraine's Bucha. A picture, which is being widely circulated, showed her dirt-covered hand with red and white polish on her nails. Bodies of several people were seen lying on streets of Bucha after the town was recaptured by Ukrainian troops.

383.title: Google Play to block downloads for outdated apps starting Nov 1
383.article_body: Google Play will hide outdated apps and block their installation starting November 1. Google said apps that don't target an Android API within two years of the latest major Android release version will no longer be able to be discovered or installed by new users whose devices run Android OS versions that are higher than the apps' target API level.

384.title: Mumbai Police's ban on construction at night put on hold till May 31
384.article_body: The Mumbai Police has been asked to put its order, banning construction after 10 pm on hold till May 31. At a review meeting with CM Uddhav Thackeray, BMC chief Iqbal Singh Chahal requested the state government to put such restrictions on hold as it was affecting the disposal of debris from the sites ahead of the monsoon season.

385.title: Omar Abdullah questioned by ED in J&K Bank scam case
385.article_body: ED on Thursday questioned former J&K CM Omar Abdullah in connection with the J&K money laundering case in Delhi. Criticising the move, his party JKNC said, "Even though this exercise is political in nature he will cooperate as there is no wrongdoing on his part." It added that Abdullah didn't seek a postponement despite this being the month of Ramzan.

386.title: Vital to go through pain, humiliation: Rajamouli on 'RRR' action scenes
386.article_body: Discussing the creation of action sequences in his movie 'RRR', director SS Rajamouli said it is important to go through the emotions of pain and humiliation if you want to attract the heart of the audience. "SS Rajamouli is the biggest filmmaker that India has probably ever seen. This maverick filmmaker cannot be real," Karan Johar had earlier stated.

387.title: Being a foodie is my roadblock, I gain 5-10 kgs in a month but I don't cry: Aly
387.article_body: Actor Aly Goni said that him being a foodie acts like a roadblock for him. "My body is...such that I can gain 5-10 kgs in a month...but I don't sit and cry about it...instead...I work on it," the actor said. He added, "I know when I need to lose weight...I don't let anything come in the way."

388.title: There were times I didn't feel protected: Alicia on filming sex scenes
388.article_body: Talking about filming sex scenes, Oscar-winning actress Alicia Vikander said she has been in situations that were not fine, adding that she didn't feel protected. "[There was an instance where] everyone was busy doing their own thing and...[I was sitting] naked for a couple of hours," added Alicia. "It's the worst thing ever to do those scenes," stated Alicia.

389.title: Faf du Plessis has got the respect of everyone in RCB: Maxwell
389.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell, who's likely to be available for their next game, has said captain Faf du Plessis has got the respect of everyone in the franchise. "Not only does he lead by example...but he also performs really well," stated Maxwell. "What I've been really excited about has been one of the old fellows, Dinesh Karthik," he further said.

390.title: Mother can't be denied child's custody if she doesn't fit the mould: HC
390.article_body: A mother cannot be denied her child's custody if she does not fit the mould, Chhattisgarh HC said. HC set aside a family court's order granting custody of a child to the father. A certificate by society's few members with an "ostrich mindset" should not be allowed to decide a woman's character, the HC ruled.

391.title: UP govt hands over Ayodhya airport land to Airports Authority of India
391.article_body: The Civil Aviation Department of Uttar Pradesh transferred the land purchased for construction of Maryada Purushottam Shri Ram International Airport at Ayodhya to the Airports Authority of India (AAI) today. The state government purchased 317.855 acres of land for the construction of an international airport at Ayodhya. The land was given on lease in presence of UP CM Yogi Adityanath.

392.title: Ex-Amnesty chief seeks ₹3.8 lakh from CBI officer after being denied US flight
392.article_body: A day after former Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel was stopped from flying to US, he demanded that the CBI investigating officer who issued a lookout circular against him must compensate for his flight tickets. "The officer must pay ₹3.8 lakh from his salary," Patel's lawyer told a Delhi court, asking for "a suitable reply" to the law enforcement agencies.

393.title: Enrolment in govt schools rose 'significantly' post pandemic: Mizoram Min
393.article_body: Student enrolment in Mizoram government schools increased 'significantly' post the COVID-19 pandemic, state Education Minister Lalchhandama Ralte said. "State government has taken several steps to improve the education system and recruit more teachers," he said, adding, it prompted more parents to send their children to government schools. Notably, schools reopened in Mizoram on Tuesday.

394.title: Pre-term baby overcomes cardiac issues, brain haemorrhage at Delhi hospital
394.article_body: A pre-term baby weighing 704 grams overcame multiple infections, cardiac issues and brain haemorrhage at Fortis Hospital in Delhi's Vasant Kunj. The baby underwent 12 blood transfusions and was under intricate treatment and care for 115 days before getting discharged. A woman had given birth to twins through in-vitro fertilization, one of whom died soon after the birth.

395.title: Delhi's peak electricity demand rises to 'highest-ever' level in March
395.article_body: Delhi's peak power demand increased to its highest-ever level of 4,648 megawatts (MW) in March 2022, the Delhi DISCOMs said. Reportedly, Delhi's peak electricity demand in March was 25% more as compared to the corresponding period of 2021. According to IMD data, India recorded its warmest March in 122 years, while Delhi's highest maximum temperature in March was 39.6°C.

396.title: Women in Ukraine cutting off hair to be 'less attractive' to Russian troops to avoid rape
396.article_body: Ukrainian women are cutting off their hair in an attempt to stop Russian troops from raping them, according to a town's deputy mayor. "Girls started cutting their hair short to be less attractive, so no one looks at them anymore," said Maryna Beschastna, ITV reported. "In one village, two sisters were raped...girls of 15 and 16...children," she stated.

397.title: Give me Babar, Virat and 9 pieces of wood, I'll win you WC: Ex-Pak captain Latif
397.article_body: Praising Virat Kohli and Babar Azam, former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said, "Give me Babar, Virat and nine pieces of wood, I will win you the World Cup." Latif referenced former Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson, who had once said, "Give me 10 pieces of wood and Zinedine Zidane and I'll win the Champions League."

398.title: Krunal Pandya is like my brother and brothers do fight: Deepak Hooda on their spat
398.article_body: Referring to his spat with Krunal Pandya which led to him leaving Baroda team last year, Deepak Hooda said that Krunal, who's his LSG teammate now, is like his brother. "Brothers do fight. We're playing with one aim, which is to win games for LSG," he said. Earlier, their picture went viral, which showed them hugging while celebrating a wicket.

399.title: Got to get out before I slap someone, jokes Jim Carrey on retirement
399.article_body: Actor-comedian Jim Carrey, who will retire from acting after 'Sonic the Hedgehog 2', jokingly said he wants to get out before he slaps someone, in an apparent reference to Will Smith slapping Chris Rock. Smith slapped Chris at the 2022 Oscars, with Carrey saying he would have sued Smith for $200 million. Smith has resigned from the Oscars Academy.

400.title: 161 died due to accidents during hazardous cleaning of sewers in 3 yrs: Govt
400.article_body: The Centre told the Parliament that 161 people died in accidents while undertaking hazardous cleaning of septic tanks and sewers in the last three years. However, there was no report of deaths due to manual scavenging, Social Justice Minister Virendra Kumar stated. He added that 118 such deaths were reported in 2019, 19 in 2020 and 24 in 2021.

401.title: PMPML to launch electric-cab facility with affordable rates in Pune
401.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Ltd (PMPML) has said that it is planning to launch an electric-cab service in the city. "There is...a need to provide service to passengers for last-mile connectivity...PMPML plans to overcome this gap through e-car service," PMPML Chairman and Managing Director Laxminarayan Mishra said. The service would be provided at affordable rates, he added.
